comments:
Resolve the mito area contradiction: report both absolute mito area per cell and percent-of-cell area, plus the exact thresholding method and saturation checks.

Disambiguate what MitoTracker intensity means: MitoTracker can reflect membrane potential as much as “mass”. Add integrated intensity, area, texture, and network metrics (skeleton length, branch points).

Do statistics at the right level: summarize per well, then compare wells (or mixed model with plate and well as random effects).

Rule out imaging artifacts: show pixel saturation rates, illumination correction sanity checks, and background distributions for the mito channel.

Pathway validation inside JUMP: test whether perturbations of negative vs positive Hedgehog regulators move mitochondria in opposite directions (e.g., SUFU, GLI1/2/3, PTCH2, HHIP, KIF7 if present).

Mechanism strengthening: add a minimal “Hh activation readout” (GLI target expression, or at least morphology correlation with known Hh activators), and ideally an inhibitor-rescue (SMO inhibitor) in follow-up wet lab.

Be more cautious on translational claims: keep “therapeutic vulnerability” as a prediction, not a conclusion, until you have functional OCR/ATP/ROS or inhibitor sensitivity data.
